goal.tools

Class BatchRun

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.BatchRun

  • public class BatchRun
extends java.lang.Object
    A Batch will run a batch of MASPrograms a repeated number of times. Between runs the state of the agents FileLearner can be persisted by setting a PersistanceHelper. To inspect the results of each run the ResultInspector can be used.
    Author:
    mpkorstanje

      • setRepeats

        public void setRepeats(long times)
        Sets the number of times the BatchRun is repeated.
        Parameters:
        times - the BatchRun is repeated

      • run

        public void run()
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts the BatchRun. This will repeat running all MASPrograms for a given number of times.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown when a run fails; if multiple runs fail, only the last exception is thrown, e.g. all runs are executed at all times

      • getDebuggerOutput

        public boolean getDebuggerOutput()
        Returns true if the MASProgram will be run with a debugger that logs output.
        Returns:
        if true the MASProgram will be run with a printing debugger.

      • setDebuggerOutput

        public void setDebuggerOutput(boolean debuggerOutput)
        Set to true to run the MASProgram with a debugger that logs output.
        Parameters:
        debuggerOutput - true if the debugger should output to the console
